_header: With favor in her face far passing my Reason
Subjects: Virgin Mary, lament of; carols, of the Passion
_description: A lament of the Virgin Mary over her Son — four 9-line stanzas (aaaabbbcc) with refrain ‘Who can not wepe come lerne of me’ and a 4-line burden: ‘Sodenly afraide / Half wakyng half slepyng / And gretly dismayde / A wooman sate weepyng’

CamTCC1450.First Lines:
With fauour yn here fare far passynge my resonAnd of here sore
                    wepynge þis was þe encheson…
CamTCC1450.Last Lines:
…Who can not wepe thys ys the layAnd with that wordys schee
                    vanyschyd a way
CamTCC1450.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,

RylandsLat395.First Lines:
With fauoure in hir face ferr passyng my ReasonAnd of hir sore
                    weepyng this was the enchesoneHir soon in hir lap lay she seid slayne by
                    treasonYif wepyng myght ripe bee it seemyd þan in
                    season…
RylandsLat395.Last Lines:
…Who cannot wepe this was the laye& with þat word she
                    vanysht away
